MYOPIC.Definition: not able to see things that are far away

HYPEROPIC.Definition: not able to see things that are close

SHORT-SIGHTED.Definition: not able to see things that are far away

LONG-SIGHTED.Definition: not able to see things that are close

VISION CORRECTION.Definition: glasses, contact lenses or laser eye surgery

TO MAKE ENDS MEET.Definition: to be able to earn enough money to survive

ORPHANAGE.Definition: a home for children with no parents, or whose parents cannot care for them

APPRENTICE.Definition: someone who works for a skilled craftsperson, normally as a way to learn how to do a particular job

ENGRAVING.Definition: the skill of designing by cutting into metal

ENCOURAGING.Definition: trying to get others to do something

PRESCRIBE.Definition: (of a doctor or optician) to say what treatment is required

DISTRIBUTORS.Definition: companies that supply products to shops

RETAILERS.Definition: shops that sell products to the public

PROFITS.Definition: the money that is made after the costs are taken away

AT THE MERCY OF.Definition: if you are at the mercy of something, you cannot do anything to protect yourself from it

FASHION STATEMENT.Definition: a piece of clothing that is chosen to make others notice you

SELF-MADE.Definition: rich and successful because of what you have done, not because you have been given money by your family

MONOPOLY.Definition: a monopoly is when a company or organisation has total control of a market

FRAMES.Definition: the part of glasses that hold the lenses

MERGED.Definition: if a company merges with another, they join and become one company

SUPPLIERS.Definition: companies that supply products to other companies

PRESCRIPTION.Definition: an optical prescription is a piece of paper that details what strength glasses or vision correction is required

DISCRETIONARY PURCHASE.Definition: something you buy that you don't need

SHARE PRICE.Definition: the price of shares in a company

EXPLOITING.Definition: using in a way that helps you, often at the expense of others

JACKING UP.Definition: increasing prices by a large amount
